intro: Parsonsia capsularis var. ochracea, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
